Guardian has officially leveled up to 2.0. 

In this version view our colorful new design in dark mode or light mode for a more personalized experience. 

We’ve also added a variety of App icons that can be set from within Settings.

Now introducing our Guardian Pro subscription service. The protection of Guardian plus customized Blocklists and Push Notifications for Alerts.

* Customized Blocklists: Add individual hosts or IP addresses to be effectively blocked, as well as try our experimental Guardian-curated firewall rules, for a privacy experience tuned to your needs.

* Push Notifications: Instant notifications when your device attempts to connect to an unwanted connection to further assist in identifying a culprit app or website. Easily filter notifications by type of Alert from within Push Notification settings.

We’ve removed the tab bar in the app and replaced the Settings tab with an easy to locate, cogwheel, to access all of the configurable settings as well as contact technical support and our Frequently Asked Questions. 

Alerts are now shown directly in the G-Shield view and you can reveal more detailed alert information by swiping up from the bottom of the Alerts menu. Filter Alerts by tapping on each type.

This minor update resolves an issue with interactions between the Guardian app and our servers as well as a few minor UI flaws. 

Some users received an error when attempting to connect that was only resolved by manually clearing the local cache in settings under Advanced. This error is fully resolved.

The authentication link generated by our website now handles the interface transition more gracefully.

The Blocklist feature now clarifies that the commonly used character * will not be recognized as a wildcard rule.

Lastly, polished up and smoothed out the user interface around the G Shield to improve overall experience.

You asked for it and we’re here to deliver! Server Region Selection has arrived.

In this feature update we’re introducing Server Region Selection. The choice is yours! If you’re the type that likes a bit more control over your connection, now you may choose to override the previously automatically selected server region by navigating to the Advanced menu in the app and tapping on Server Region to view all regions to choose from. You can choose to connect to the new region immediately, or choose “later” to indicate switching to the new region the next time you connect to Guardian. 

If you’re the type that likes to set it and forget it, you may simply continue pressing the G Shield to connect to Guardian Firewall and the most proximate server will be automatically selected to establish a connection based on device system time zone. 

We’ve treated light and dark themes to a few minor touch ups of coloring hues to maintain a flawless aesthetic as well as cleaned up a few rare bugs.

This update is filled with great new features we are excited to introduce. If you’re a current subscriber to Guardian or Guardian Pro, check your app for an added bonus to celebrate this holiday season. With the introduction of Day Pass Sharing, we’re providing a set of Day Passes to share with family or friends.

- Day Pass Sharing
Your Day Pass balance can be found in Settings. From this menu you can instantly activate for yourself or share Day Passes with friends and family. No need to sign-up, no need to instantly use all Day Passes. Add Day Passes to your balance in the app and activate Day Passes whenever you want.

- iPad Support
Guardian is now optimised to look right at home on iPad. We touched every interface in the app to provide a well balanced experience that blends into your workflow.

- Share VPN Credentials
You can now generate additional VPN credentials from the Advanced menu and either share a .mobileconfig profile with your Mac via AirDrop or you can enter the credentials manually on any other platform that supports IKEv2. 

- Accessibility
Many improvements have been made to the interface elements including Alerts which can be pulled up from the bottom of the screen. The Alerts menu has been optimised to enable users who are proficient with VoiceOver to navigate our app with ease. We are committed to continuously improving Guardian and empower everyone to take control of their privacy.

It’s finally here! Introducing Exceptions; a powerful feature we are proud to bring to the Guardian Firewall experience. 

If you are enjoying Guardian Firewall + VPN, we’d like to encourage you to rate or review our app in the App Store.

Exceptions: This feature provides even more configuration of our Firewall + VPN service to cater to your specific needs. Can’t re-watch Mandalorian episodes because Disney + doesn’t play well with Guardian? Now, with exceptions, you can! 

The Exceptions feature was created to allow users to precisely define what traffic should be excluded from being filtered by our firewall servers while still providing firewall and VPN protection to all other traffic. If you have noticed a website or application on your iOS device is acting up or simply won't load while Guardian is connected, this new feature solves this issue by allowing you to simply add the website URL or application to the Exceptions list. Once added, these specific apps or websites will be excluded from being routed through our firewall to create an uninterrupted experience all while continuing to protect and filter all other traffic as you use your device.

Enter any hostname you wish to exclude or search for the name of an iOS app in our database with over 14,000 analyzed applications. Our app database continues to be regularly updated to ensure the best possible compatibility.

For Pro users, we have completely overhauled the interface to generate additional VPN credentials, and added more sharing capability to share VPN credentials to other mobile OS using a .sswan StrongSwan compatible file.

This update also includes the ability to reset the Alerts menu counts to zero. It is like a day trip odometer for your app allowing you to quickly reset everything, as if you had just downloaded our app for the first time.

The Exceptions feature was created to allow users to precisely define what traffic should be excluded from being filtered by our firewall servers while still providing firewall and VPN protection to all other traffic. If you have noticed a website or application on your iOS device is acting up or simply won't load while Guardian is connected, this new feature solves this issue by allowing you to simply add the website URL or application to the Exceptions list. Once added, these specific apps or websites will be excluded from being routed through our firewall to create an uninterrupted experience all while continuing to protect and filter all other traffic as you use your device.

Enter any hostname you wish to exclude or search for the name of an iOS app in our database with over 14,000 analyzed applications. Our app database continues to be regularly updated to ensure the best possible compatibility.

For Pro users, we have completely overhauled the interface to generate additional VPN credentials, and added more sharing capability to share VPN credentials to other mobile OS using a .sswan StrongSwan compatible file.

This update also includes the ability to reset the Alerts menu counts to zero. It is like a day trip odometer for your app allowing you to quickly reset everything, as if you had just downloaded our app for the first time.

After some very helpful reports from a few users with lots of screenshots we were able to hunt down a state disconnect in the Exceptions feature. Sometimes it would be off when it shouldn't be and sometimes it would end up being enabled when it shouldn't be, but no more! Once enabled, the Exceptions feature should now be turned on and off with the VPN connection automatically. If the VPN connection to our secure nodes is enabled and you setup Exceptions for your device, the feature should always be enabled, unless manually disabled of course.

We added a new feature for our Pro users that subscribed via the in-app purchase to cross authenticate in our new Mac app. Instead of copying a long scrambled piece of text into the Mac app you now only have to tap the button "Generate macOS Access Code" in Guardian Settings > Advanced and then type the 6 character string into our app on your Mac. We hope that this significantly streamlines the process for our customers interested in trying our new Mac app.

This update also addresses a couple of crashes, especially in our Notification menu which should no longer happen.
If you encounter any problems please feel free to reach out to us via the "Contact Technical Support" button. We are always aiming to provide a great experience to everybody but sometimes problems surface or bugs show their ugly faces. If you encounter anything please reach out to us, we are always happy to provide assistance!

We are pleased to introduce new features in this minor update to Guardian Firewall + VPN. 

If you are enjoying Guardian Firewall + VPN, we’d like to encourage you to rate or review our app in the App Store. We continue to deploy new servers for you around the world to provide the best possible quality of service to as many subscribers as possible.

NEW: Access to Experimental Features - Pro subscribers may now access upcoming features prior to general availability. We have added a new experimental toggle to the Advanced menu of Guardian’s in-app Settings (Tap the Gear icon in the top right to access). By enabling the option, your device will connect to Guardian gateways running updated revisions of our infrastructure software. All existing features should always work and continue to be reliable, but optimizations may be completed server side to enable early access to new features. We are currently working on many feature additions to our cloud firewall and hope to roll these out to our Pro customers frequently.

NEW: Bypass Firewall Rules - The first addition of new features for Pro subscribers, Bypass Firewall Rules, can be found in the Advanced menu of Guardian’s in-app Settings. Enabling this feature will route your connection through Guardian’s secure tunnel, without enforcement of our standard firewall rule sets. This can be useful when accessing apps and websites which do not function properly if tracking/advertising software is blocked. 
To enable this capability please navigate into Guardian Settings > Advanced > Enable Experimental Features (Pro Only) and then enable Bypass Firewall Rules.

ENHANCEMENT: To continue improving our support team’s ability to resolve issues for users, we have introduced a persistent log feature. No personally identifiable information is ever logged, nor do the contents of the log ever leave your device unless specifically enabled in our Contact Technical Support form. The log is never longer than 200 lines to be respectful of your device's disk space and always stored in plain text to be easily accessible and reviewable by any customer. 
It is recommended to keep this setting enabled, but we understand and respect if some customers prefer to disable it. If you prefer to disable it, please navigate to Guardian Settings > Advanced and disable Persistent Debug Logs in the Local Data Management section.

We also resolved a few minor bugs, including a bug which would immediately ask to setup the Guardian Configuration VPN profile after initially downloading and opening the app. Fully resolved, the tunnel configuration is only installed if the Exceptions feature is enabled. We sincerely apologize to any new users who encountered this bug.

Thank you very much for your feedback and sustained support. It means the world to our little team!

IMPROVED: We irregularly received reports that the server selection feature was too hidden and required too many taps to get to. We moved this feature to allow users to switch regions directly from the main Settings interface. Simply tap on Location above the “Reset Configuration” option to choose your preferred location to connect to.

FIXED: A handful of users noted that their in-app purchase subscriptions were being ignored entirely which led to them being unable to enable the firewall by establishing the VPN connection. Possibly old, lingering values are now cleared more thoroughly to prevent this problem.

FIXED: Users may have been notified of a new in-app notification only to discover they were not able to read/view the notification. This problem should now be resolved and new notifications should be marked as read properly.

FIXED: The button to confirm resetting the VPN configuration may have been unresponsive or not visible in the interface at all on certain iPad models in Portrait orientation.
